basics.name: Mitchell Gerhardt
basics.summary: Ph.D. candidate in Engineering Education with expertise in AI in education, STEM graduate engineering education, human-computer interaction, natural language processing, epistemic thinking, epistemic cultures, and collaborative learning.

details: Committee: Courtney Faber, Andrew Katz (Chair), Holly Matusovich, and Nicole Pitterson
Committee: Sara Hooshangi (Chair), Andrew Katz, Naren Ramakrishnan
courses: Applied Design and Assessment of Educational Environments in Engineering

details: Graduated Magna Cum Laude and on Dean's List
Pratt Engineering Scholarship, Donald and Madeline Stewart Scholarship, and Konrad-Steinmetz Scholarship for Engineering Leadership Awardee
Hardware Team Lead for AutoDrive Design Team

work.company: Center for Excellence in Teaching and Learning (CETL), Virginia Tech
work.position: Graduate Assistant to the Director for Special Programs
work.summary: Work with Dr. Tiffany Shoop on various teaching and learning initiatives
highlights: Conducted mid-semester feedback sessions across various disciplines
Developed and presented faculty workshop on Interactive Lecturing with approximately 30 attendees
Co-led implementation of CIRTL program at Virginia Tech
Helped organize 17th annual Conference on Higher Education Pedagogy (CHEP)
Systematically reviewed empirical research on Collaborative Online Interactive Learning (COIL)

work.summary: Multiple roles in software-defined vehicle development
highlights: Software Engineer - Software Defined Vehicle: Developed next-gen software infrastructures and technology
Infotainment Technical Program Manager: Planned, executed, and delivered leading-edge technology
Complexity Optimization Engineer: Engaged in measuring, managing strategy, and reducing program complexity

work.position: Autonomy Systems Research - Software Engineer I
work.summary: Implemented control interfaces and validated sensor data for autonomous machinery
highlights: Implemented control interface for autonomy simulation platform using ROS
Validated and integrated sensor data on large-scale machinery into algorithms for mapping and navigation
Developed CI/CD protocols and workflows for software distribution using Docker, ROS, and C++ testing framework

research_experience.institution: Department of Engineering Education, Virginia Tech
research_experience.project: NSF Award #2300977: Design for Sustainability: How Mental Models of Social-Ecological Systems Shape Engineering Design Decisions
highlights: Developed novel natural language processing (NLP) methodology for generating qualitative codebooks from large datasets
Co-authored journal publication in International Journal of Qualitative Methods outlining EECS workflow
Applied open-source large language models to preserve data security and privacy

research_experience.institution: Department of Engineering Education, Virginia Tech
research_experience.project: NSF Award #2217523: Collaborative Research: Collaboration in Engineering Student and Practitioner Teams: A Study of Beliefs about Effective Behaviors
highlights: Designed and implemented pilot study examining collaborative behaviors in senior engineering capstone teams
Co-authored conference paper for 2024 Capstone Design Conference
Expanded conference paper into accepted journal article

projects.name: Graduate Courses Analysis Tool
projects.description: Web application that extracts structured course data from PDF timetables, identifying underenrolled graduate courses for enrollment analysis

projects.name: Epistemic Climate Analysis in CS Education
projects.description: NLP-based analysis of computer science textbook knowledge types using large language models to examine epistemic climate

service.description: Serve as trained facilitator for academic integrity discussions and participate in Review Panels
Represent department in recruitment and outreach activities
